scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel are there, discussing
the night before.]

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ross kissed me.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: It was unbelievable!

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Ok, all right. We want to hear everything. Monica, get the wine and unplug the phone. Rachel, does this end well or do we need to get tissues?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh, it ended very well.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [getting the wine] Do not start without me. Do not start without me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Ok, all right, let's hear about the kiss. Was it like, was it like a soft brush against your lips? Or was it like a, you know, a "I gotta have you now" kind of thing?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Well, at first it was really intense, you know. And then, oh, god, and then we just sort of sunk into it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Ok, so, ok, was he holding you? Or was his hand like on your back?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: No, actually first they started on my waist. And then, they slid up, and then, they were in my hair.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE/MNCA
dialogue.text: Ohhhh.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel are there, discussing
the night before.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Ross' apartment. Ross, Chandler, and Joey are there eating pizza.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And, uh, and then I kissed her.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Tongue?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Cool.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Ross' apartment. Ross, Chandler, and Joey are there eating pizza.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk . Joey, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are there; Chandler is
showing everyone his new computer.]

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: All right, check out this bad boy. 12 megabytes of ram. 500 megabyte hard drive. Built-in spreadsheet capabilities and a modem that transmits at over 28,000 b.p.s.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Wow. What are you gonna use it for?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: [doggedly] Games and stuff.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [reading the paper] There are no jobs. There are no jobs for me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: [reading over her shoulder] Wait, here's one. Uh, would you be willing to cook naked?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: There's an ad for a naked chef?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, but if you're willing to cook naked, then you might be willing to dance naked. And then... [rubs his fingers together]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Hey, oh, so, um...how'd you make out last night?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That, that is funny. That is painfully funny. No, wait. Wait, yeah, that's just painful

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Wait a minute. I thought last night was great.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was, but...I get home, ok, and I see Julie's saline solution on my night table. And I'm thinking to myself, oh my god, what the hell am I doing? I mean, here I am, I am with Julie, this incredible, great woman, who I care about and who cares about me, and I'm like, what, am I just gonna throw all that away?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You got all that from saline solution?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: We are talking about Rachel here. You and Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Believe me, I've been dreaming about me and Rachel for ten years now. But now, I'm with Julie, so it's like me and Julie, me and Rachel, me and Julie, me and... [Rachel enters, carrying a tray]... Rachel. Rachel, Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: [to Ross] Hey, you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How are you?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Good. How are you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Good.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Hi, honey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi, Julie. [nervous] Hi, Julie. Julie, um, how are you?

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Good.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [uncomfortable] Good, so everybody's here. Everybody's good. So, were you gonna play something, Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Oh, well, actually.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [impatient] Play it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Ok, all right.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Julie, I didn't know you wore lenses.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [to Joey] Ssshh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Ok, um, hi, hello, hi, ok, so, um, this is a song about a love triangle between three people that I made up. Um, it's called, um, "Two of Them Kissed Last Night".

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: [singing] There was a girl, we'll call her Betty, and a guy let's call him Neil. Now I can't stress this point too strongly, this story isn't real. Now our Neil must decide, who will be the girl that he casts aside. Will Betty be the one who he loves truly? Or will it be the one who we'll call Ju...Loolie? He must decide, he must decide, even though I made him up, he must decide!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk . Joey, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are there; Chandler is
showing everyone his new computer.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Mr. Ratstatter's (RTST) office. Monica is there about a job.]

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: This is a nice resume. Nice, nice, nice. Muy impressivo.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: So, Mr. Rastatter, what exactly does this job entail? The ad wasn't too clear.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Mockolate.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry?

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Mockolate. It's a completely synthetic chocolate substitute.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Ohh.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Go ahead. Try a piece. Yeah, we think that Mockolate is even better than chocolate.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: All right. Mmm-mmm.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [disgusted, trying not to show it] I love how it crumbles. Now see, your chocolate doesn't do that.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: No, ma'am. Well, anyhoo, we should be getting our F.D.A. approval any day now, hopefully, in time for Thanksgiving. See, the way we look at it, chocolate already dominates most of your

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [still chewing] Mmm-mmm.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: But, we're thinking, given the right marketing, we can make Thanksgiving the Mockolate holiday.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Aren't you going to swallow that?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Just waiting for it to stop bubbling.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Yeah, isn't that great?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [with false enthusiasm] Mmm.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Well, anyhoo, um, we are looking for a couple of chefs who can create some Thanksgiving-themed recipes. You think you might be interested?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Abso...[swallows hard]...lutely. See, I love creating new recipes. I love Thanksgiving. And, well, now, I love Mockolate.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Especially the after taste, you know, I'll tell ya, that'll last ya till Christmas.

scenes.location: Mr. Ratstatter's (RTST) office. Monica is there about a job.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Mr. Ratstatter's (RTST) office. Monica is there about a job.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Phoebe are there. Monica is
suggesting Mockolate recipes to Phoebe.]

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: How about Mockolate mousse?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: It's not, it's not very Thanksgiving-y.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Ok, how about pilgrim Mockolate mousse?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: What makes it pilgrim?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: We'll put buckles on it.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Did uh, Ross call?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: No, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Why didn't he call? He's gonna stay with Julie, isn't he? He's gonna stay with her and she's going to be all, "Hi, I'm Julie, Ross picked me, and we're gonna to get married, have a lot of kids and dig up stuff together."

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: No offense, but that sounds nothing like her.

scenes.location:
Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Phoebe are there. Monica is
suggesting Mockolate recipes to Phoebe.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Phoebe are there. Monica is
suggesting Mockolate recipes to Phoebe.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Ross is up in arms about the Rachel/Julie
situation.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know what to do. What am I gonna do? I mean, this, this is like a complete nightmare.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Oh, I know. This must be so hard. Oh, no. Two women love me. They're both gorgeous and sexy. My wallet's too small for my fifties, and my diamond shoes are too tight.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, here's a thought, Ross. [reaches for the computer]

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Don't touch the computer. Don't ever touch the computer.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ross, listen. I got two words for you. Threesome.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Ok, all right, look. Let's get logical about this, ok? We'll make a list. Rachel and Julie, pros and cons. Oh. We'll put their names in bold, with different fonts, and I can use different colors for each column.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Can't we just use a pen?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: No, Amish boy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ok, let's start with the cons, 'cause they're more fun. All right, Rachel first.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know. I mean, all right, I guess you can say she's a little spoiled sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You could say that.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And I guess, you know, sometimes, she's a little ditzy, you know. And I've seen her be a little too into her looks. Oh, and Julie and I, we have a lot in common 'cause we're both paleontologists, but Rachel's just a waitress.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Waitress. Got it. You guys wanna play Doom? Or we could keep doing this. What else?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, her ankles are a little chubby.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Ok, let's do Julie. What's wrong with her?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [long pause] She's not Rachel.

scenes.location:
Chandler and Joey's apartment. Ross is up in arms about the Rachel/Julie
situation.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Ross is up in arms about the Rachel/Julie
situation.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica has made food for Phoebe and Rachel to
taste.]

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Ok, this is pumpkin pie with mockolate cookie crumb crust. This is mockolate cranberry cake, and these are mockolate chip cookies. Just like the Indians served.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh my god good?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh my god, I can't believe you let me put this in my mouth.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Oh, oh sweet Lord! This is what evil must taste like!

scenes.location:
Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica has made food for Phoebe and Rachel to
taste.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica has made food for Phoebe and Rachel to
taste.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is on the phone with a computer
hotline.]

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: I'm telling you this thing won't print. Yes, I pressed that button like 100 times. You know, for a hot line you are not so hot. What? What is that in the background? Are you watching Star Trek?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: [to Ross] Hey, so how'd it go with Julie? Did you, did you break her heart?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, it was horrible. She cried. I cried. She threw things, they hit me. Anyway, I did the right thing.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: [in phone] So, Spock actually hugs his father?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Hey, do you guys have...[sees Ross, pauses]...hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: [sees his coat on] Where you goin'?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I uh, I just got back from uh, from Julie's.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: [dejected] Oh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, uh, it's not what you think. It's um the other thing.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Well, what's the other thing, what do I think?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, uh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He broke up with Julie. Well, go hug her, for god's sakes.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Really. It's always been you, Rach.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh, god.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY/CHAN
dialogue.text: Ohhh.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, this is good, this is really good.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know, I know, it's, it's almost...[turns around, sees Chandler and Joey] What do you say we go take a walk, just us, not them?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Let me get my coat.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok. No, hey, whoa, whoa, I'll get your coat.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ok, he's goin' to get my coat. He's goin' to get my coat. Oh my god, you guys. I can't believe this. This is unbelievable. [notices Chandler's computer screen] What's that?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: [nervous] What? Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: What's that? What? I saw my name. What is it?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: No, no, see? See? [the printer starts to run] Hey, it's printing. [to Joey, rattled] Hey, it's printing!

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Well what is it? Let me see.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, someone order a coat?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ross, Chandler wrote something about me on his computer and he won't let me see.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He won't? [remembers what it is] He won't! Because, isn't that, isn't that the, the short story you were writing?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Yes, yes it is, short story, that I was writing.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: And I'm in it? Then let me read it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Come on.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, uh, why don't you read it to her?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: [through gritted teeth] Alright. [clears his throat] "It was summer, and it was hot. Rachel was there. A lonely gray couch. 'Oh, look,' cried Ned, and then the kingdom was his forever. The end."

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's it? That's all you wrote? You're the worst writer in the whole world.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: All right, you know what? This isn't funny anymore. There's something about me on that piece of paper and I want to see it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, you don't.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: All right, you know what, that's fine. If you guys want to be children about this, that's fine. I do not need to see it. [Rachel grabs the paper and runs across the room, reading it to herself.]

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: What is this? Ross, what is this?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Good luck.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, just, just remember how crazy I am about you, ok?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Kind of ditzy? Too into her looks? Spoiled?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Now that's a little spoiled. He was supposed to type "little", the idiot.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Just a waitress?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, that, that was, I mean, as opposed to uh, the uh, ok. Is this over yet Rach?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh! I do not have chubby ankles!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, wait, ok, ok, look at the other side. Look at Julie's column.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: She is not Rachem . What the hell's a Rachem? Is that some stupid paleontology word that I wouldn't know because I'm just a waitress.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, Rach, come on. Rach! Rach, no, no! She's not Rachel, she is, she is not, Ra--Rachel?

scenes.location:
Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is on the phone with a computer
hotline.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is on the phone with a computer
hotline.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk . Chandler, Monica, Joey, and Phoebe are there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: My diary! My diary, that's brilliant. I should have told her it was my diary, she never would have made me read her my diary.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: You know, that's true. You'd be a great person to have around the day after an emergency.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: I... I cannot believe Ross even made this list. What a dinkus.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, cut him some slack. It was Chandler's idea.

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Oh good, I was hoping that would come up.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: This was your idea?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: What were you thinking?

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: [squirming] All right, let's get some perspective here, ok? These things, they happen for a reason.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Yeah. You!

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: All right, Pheebs, back me up here, ok? You believe in that karma crap, don't you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Yeah, by the way, good luck in your next life as a dung beetle.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk . Chandler, Monica, Joey, and Phoebe are there.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Rachel is sitting on the couch, eating candy. It
is raining out. Ross climbs up the fire escape and is knocking on the window.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach! Whoops! Rach, hey, open up, please!

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: [coldly] When somebody does not buzz you in, Ross, that means go away. That doesn't mean please climb up the fire escape.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I just wanna read something. It's your pro list.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Not interested.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [reading his list] Ok, ok,

dialogue.speaker: NUMBER ONE
dialogue.text: The way yo

dialogue.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogue.text: the way you smell.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: [opens the drapes] Hey, Ross! What are you doin'?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, Joey. You wanna open the window?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, I do.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: What are you doing out there?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I am, uh, I am...

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh, you must be freezing. You know what you need? How about a nice steaming cup of hot Mockolate?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach, come on, open up. Rach, come on, come on, Rach. You got to give me another chance.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: That's what I said.

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Look, maybe we should go?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: No, you guys, you really don't have to go, we're done talking.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach, come on, look, I know how you must feel.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: [near tears] No, you don't, Ross. Imagine the worst things you think about yourself. Now, how would you feel if the one person that you trusted the most in the world not only thinks them too, but actually uses them as reasons not to be with you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, but, but I wanna be with you in spite of all those things.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh, well, that's, that's mighty big of you, Ross. [to the others] I said don't go!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You know what? You know what? If, things were the other way around, there's nothing you could put on a list that would ever make me not want to be with you.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Well, then, I guess that's the difference between us. See, I'd never make a list.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: [quietly] I never know how long you're supposed to wait in this type of a situation before you can talk again, you know? [Ross stares blankly at him] Maybe a little longer.

scenes.location: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Rachel is sitting on the couch
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Rachel is sitting on the couch, eating candy. It
is raining out. Ross climbs up the fire escape and is knocking on the window.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Mr. Ratstatter's office. Monica is there.]

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Now, in some of these recipes, the quantities may seem just a little unusual, uh, like these coconut mockolate holiday nut bars. I've indicated four cups of coconut, and four cups of crushed nut, and only, uh, one tablespoon of mockolate.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Doesn't matter.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Our FDA approval didn't come through. Something about laboratory rats.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh, gosh, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, anyhoo, here is your check. [hands it to her] Thank you for all the trouble you went through. Um, listen, you didn't eat a lot of it while you were cooking, did you?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Well, uh, I ate some.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Oh, some, that's fine. Some is fine. Some is not a lot. So, it doesn't burn when you pee, does it?

scenes.location: Mr. Ratstatter's office. Monica is there.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Mr. Ratstatter's office. Monica is there.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Rachel are there.]

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: [to Monica] Is that him again? Tell him I'd come to the phone, but my ankles are weighin' me down.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: [to Ross] Listen, I... I don't think this is the best time.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, can, can you do something for me?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Sure, what? Ok, ok. [hangs up the phone] [to Rachel] Music?

dialogue.speaker: RADIO
dialogue.text: The next one's dedicated to Rachel from Ross. Rachel, he wants you to know he's deeply sorry for what he did and he hopes you can find it in your heart to forgive him. ( With or Without You plays)

dialogue.speaker: RADIO
dialogue.text: Uh, we've just gotten a call from Rachel, and she told us what Ross did. It's pretty appalling, and Ross, if you're listening, I don't wanna play your song anymore. Why don't we devote our time to a couple that stands a chance? Avery, Michelle's sorry she hit you with her car and she hopes you two will work it out.

scenes.location: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Rachel are there.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Rachel are there.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Mr. Ratstatter's office. Monica is there.]

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Hi, thanks for coming in again.

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Oh, not at all. I have no morals and I need the cash.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: It's like I'm lookin' in a mirror. Anyway, they're called "fishtachios". They taste exactly like pistachios, but they're made primarily of reconstituted fish bits. Here, try one. You're not allergic to anything, are you?

dialogue.speaker: MNCA
dialogue.text: Cat hair.

dialogue.speaker: RTST
dialogue.text: Oh, sorry.

scenes.location: Mr. Ratstatter's office. Monica is there.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Mr. Ratstatter's office. Monica is there.]
